definition: handle/(fig.) information that can be used against sb
handle
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades

sentences.english: It is also used in other applications such as coat hangers and handles.
sentences.chinese: 也用於其他應用例如掛衣架和把柄。

sentences.english: Brasss rod was used for the handles.
All have a reversible thumb knob for one-hand easy opening and spring-loaded lock for closing.
sentences.chinese: 逆向拇指把柄，一隻手就可以將其輕鬆打開或閉合。

sentences.english: The same trowel rests in my hand now, though the handle has loosened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 那把泥鏟現在就在我的手上，儘管許多年來把柄鬆了。

sentences.english: Hold your finger out straight and place the shaft of the racket on to the finger.
sentences.chinese: 有時拍柄上所纏把柄膠的重量會使球拍平衡點的移動。

sentences.english: In addition, must get control Chang Fu.
sentences.chinese: 另外，必須拿到控制常福的把柄。

sentences.english: "We simply got the goods on him, " Figliolia said.
sentences.chinese: 斐格里奧利亞說，“我們根本掌握了他的把柄。”

sentences.english: The policemen kept blackmailing him, because they had sth. on him.
sentences.chinese: 那些警察之所以經常去敲他的竹槓是因爲抓住把柄了。

sentences.english: You must be cautious when being interviewed by the press, or you might say something against yourself.
sentences.chinese: 接受媒體採訪時一定要慎言，不要被抓住了把柄。

sentences.english: The fadeout allows the bow to hinge thus allowing the bow to bend a little bit at the handle.
sentences.chinese: 淡出允許弓取決於因而允許弓稍微彎曲在把柄。

definition: a pretext for gossip/a matter for derision
reliable evidence (idiom); conclusive proof/definitive evidence
fault
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
food/salary (old)/a pretext/a cause for gossip
to use (sb) as a tool
to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to threaten/to blackmail
to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
to catch sb out
to make a false countercharge
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
